intro: Restio setiger, commonly known as the tufted restio, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, cylindrical spike that bears small, white to pale yellow flowers. Restio setiger is typically found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
